tool.name: Download and align
tool.description: Downloads fastq.gz, unzips, trims with cutadapt and alignes to reference
tool.command: #set index_path = '' #if str($reference_genome.source) == "history": bowtie2-build "$reference_genome.own_file" genome && ln -s "$reference_genome.own_file" genome.fa && #set index_path = 'genome' #else: #set index_path = $reference_genome.index.fields.path #end if wget -O - $input.file | gunzip -c | cutadapt --format=fastq -a 'AGATCGGAAGAGC' -A 'AGATCGGAAGAGC' - | bowtie2 -f ## index file path -x $index_path -U - | samtools view -bS > $output

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options. See `Indexes` section of help below
param.option: Use a genome from the history and build index

param.name: index
param.label: Select reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the Galaxy team

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
This tool extracts reads from sra, runs cutdapt and bowtie and outputs a bam file.
Contact Eduardo Alves at eduardoalves@abdn.ac.uk for support and bug reports.
